reviews: Świetny owocowo palony zapach, chlebek, ciemna czekolada. Z wyglądu niemal czarne z ładną ciemno beżową pianą.…

Bottle from Connolly's Wine Merchants entitled '2021 Merry Christmas Happy New Year'. Pours quite thick black with moderate beige head. Aroma of malt, cinnamon, dark fruits, nutmeg. Taste of malts, molasses, Christmas spice, dark fruit, some roast in the finish with a slight coffee and herbal bitterness. Good beer although could have been even better. I just feel it might be missing something to bring it all together.
On Tap at Shakespeare's, Sheffield 17/12/2011 Big caramel aroma. Dark coloured and rich on the palate with some alcohol present. Bitter with a hint of dryness in a treacle malt finish.

Аромат во многом со специами, особенно корица, есть какие то нотки от темного шоколада, возможно немного трав. Цвет почти черный, есть тонкая пенка. Вкус неплохой. Снова наиеки на темный шоколад с какой то ягодой. Уже много специй, включая корицу и присыпку для пироженого, но без сладости и даже с сухостью. Есть травы от хмеля при глотке. В целом приятный зимний эль.
Bottle at home, 13th January 2022.  Pours a dark brown.  Aroma is spice, cherry, chocolate, malts.  Taste is spice, cherry, quite easy to drink, interesting, medicinal.  Good

(2021) zapach intensywny, okrągły, toffi, lekka melasa, słody, tostowane nuty, dobrej jakości praliny, słodka czekolada, lekkie czerwone owoce, w tle dobrze ułożony alkohol. całość dobrze zgrana. kolor czarny, pod światło ciemnoczerowny, klarowny. piana brązowa, średnio obfita, mało trwała. w smaku intensywne, ciemno palona kawa, nuty palone, czerwone owoce i jagody, żurawina, goji, wytrawne śliwki, drewno, lekkie nuty wytrawnego rumu, przypalony tost, bardzo wytrawna melasa. całość bardzo dobrze zgrana. goryczka dość spora, palona, kawowa, alkoholowa, czysta. w ustach lekko rozgrzewające, ale zaskakująco pijalne. nasycenie wysokie
2021: black; roasted malt aroma with spicy notes; dry, roasted malt flavor with cinnamon and nutmeg spice notes; some raisin and dark fruit notes; medium bodied

1.5 bottle @ home
Quite a Christmas feel on the nose. Definitely sweetish with some bitter herbal undertones. Medium-bodied, bitter towards the end.

Bottle poured into a shaker. Cola brown color with a fizzy tan head. Aroma is chocolate, cinnamon, caramel, nutmeg. Initial taste is roast, cinnamon, spices, herbal. Fades to a pepper. Body is light-medium. Carbonation is sharp. Nice.
Dark pour with a thin tan head. Malty aroma with berries and Christmas cookie spices on the tongue.

Kalendarz adwentowy 2021/12 Edycja piwa 2021

Dużo karmelu i suszonych owoców (od jabłka, przez morele po śliwki), mieszanka przypraw jest trudna do zdefiniowania, trochę odmienna od naszych, bardziej ziołowa i wytrawna niż korzenna... Znam ten smak z jakiegoś bodaj Hiszpańskiego piwa, ale nie pamiętam nazwy :( Piwo raczej wytrawne, acz są słodkie akcenty. Jak na styl spora, ziołowa goryczka.

Dark beer, thick head. Smells malty with spices. Cloves and cinnamon. The Christmas smell. Flavour follows suit. Loads of spice up front, malt, some caramel, a hint of chocolate. A touch of boozy warmth. Very drinkable. A proper Christmas beer.
barwa czarna. piana kremowa. aromat ciemne slody przyprawy. smak piernik, kawa, ciemne słody. wysyceni ok. goryczka srednia

Pić świąteczne (i to jakie!) piwo w maju to trochę profanacja, ale dopiero co nabyłem. 
Czarne. Bez prześwitów. Piana spora, jasno brązowa. Dużo średnich oczek. Stabilna. Przy drugim nalaniu drobniutka. Aromat korzenny, piernikowy. 
Czekoladowo chlebowe. Lekki kawowy kwasek. Delikatna goryczka. Bardzo starannie dobrane dodatki. Żadnych indywidualnych harców. Wszystko ze sobą pasuje, nic nie wystaje. Chyba najlepsze ze świątecznych z jakimi miałem do czynienia.

On tap at Bigby's Pour House in Addison, IL. served to a snifter showing a black/brown hue, with a finger's width of light tan froth, and doily-like spots & spray as lacing. The aroma was roasted, cocoa, slight dark dried fruit, a touch of treacle, and some dryness to the nose. Medium+ bodied, with low carbonation, the taste was similar notes, with decent alcohol presence, and low toast & roast bitterness. Kind of a stout-like brew, without the hefty maltiness.
Doft av mörkt bröd. Mörk vätska med tjockt beige skum. Smak av vörtbröd, jäst, choklad. Fyllig, lätt bitter smak.
Dark brown colour, small head. Aroma is cocoa, some clove. Light sweetness, light bitterness. Light body, medium carbonation. Easy to drink, good.
Dark brown. Thick tan head. Aroma is sweet malt. Taste is sweet malt, brown sugar, sweet with a little bitter. Ok.
Aromat piernikowy, przyprawowy. W smaku bardziej w kierunku black ipa. Fajne palone z wyraźna goryczka. Czuć też świeżość i ziołowość. Dobre.

Mörk mahogny med tunt fint beige skum. Doftar maltigt, lite kryddigt, muscovadosocker och toffé. Smaken fyllig, söt, lite kaffe och lakrits. Eftersmaken lite söt och besk, kaffe och lakrits, kryddig på slutet.

Liquide marron foncé avec mousse courte. Nez malté caramel et légèrement épicé. En bouche, c'est une attaque légèrement torréfiée sucrée qui débouche sur une belle amertume de fèves de cacao torréfiées avec une impression très soyeuse dans la bouche. Il s'agissait ici d'un release de 2017.

Dark brown with thin creamy foam

Caramel, coffee, sweet malt, darker milk chocolate, pine and slight sweet cocktail Sherry

Creamy, tangy, dark coffee with sugar, nice malt and some citrus note.  Toasty, with long slight hoppy finish.
2020: Pretty Coke-like with sweet malts and spices. Medium carb. Some light bitter dark chocolate. Not overpowering.
7.0% black in colour with a nice brown head, a sweet plum aroma the taste is bitter sweet with a hint of licorice.

Väl utjäst IPA. Karamell knäck o lite pomerans men ganska avhuggen. Karaktär av gamla skolan ale men med tendens åt jul och dess vört. Vört grov o kornig. Bitterheten gör ölet, den sitter som en smäck långt efteråt.

Copenhagen 3/12 2020. 35,5 cl bottle from Meny, Østerfælled Torv, Kbh. Ø. As “Merry Christmas Happy New Year 2019 Ale”. Big pine tree on the label. 

Pours clear but very dark brown with a red hue. Small off-white head. Settles as thin and flimsy remnants of foam unable to cover the surface of the beer. No lacing. 

Aroma is medium intense with a sweet slightly spicy odor mingling with light tart notes. Toffee and caramel. Hints of nuts. Light scent of tart berries. 

Medium strong carbonation. Slightly thick, oily, lively and tingling texture. 

Flavor is medium intense with a fairly strong sweetness followed by a moderate bitterness. Aftertaste is sweet and lingers for a while. Finish is caramelly. 

If a Christmas beer is all about being toffee-like and pleasant this one hits the mark.

2019 Vintage bottle. Sweet and rich aroma of molasses, brown sugar and dark fruit. Pours with a dark brown colour and mid-sized light brown head. Minimal carbonation. Malt forward flavour with notes of spice, dark chocolate, pepper and dark fruits. Full bodied. Sweet malt finish. Good Christmas ale.
A festive brew and pretty strong. I like it more than the regular anchor steam beer. Slight malty slight hoppy smell. Smooth like the other steam beers but with more bitter malty bite.

2020 / 7.0% / 40IBU / Pours a pitch black with a small foamy tan head. Moderate aroma of roasted malts. Medium body with some oily lacing. Smooth with a slightly dry dark cocoa taste and some light spices. Enjoyable with a pleasant lingering aftertaste.

A 355ml bottle, 2018 vintage, 6.9ABV, from Little Leeds Beer House a year ago & stored in my cellar. Pours brown with a white head. Aromas & tastes of caramel, licorice, spices, herbal, pine & malt. Medium body. Spiced malty finish. Very enjoyable

355 ml bottle, 2019 Vintage. 6.9 % alcohol. Dark reddish amber colour with a thin lightly tanned head. Sweet aroma with caramel malts, spices, liqourice, fruits, herbal hoppy notes. Taste is sweet. Medium bodied. Slightly drying finish with spiced notes and hops. Nice Winter Warmer.

Bière qui était auparavant en american strong ale, passé maintenant en 
flavored, ce que doit être assurément une christmas.
Le niveau abv de mon exemplaire intitulé " merry christmas 2017 ", 
était de 6,7 % .. ce qui est un peu mieux que le 5,5 indiqué sur le site,
mais ce qui n'en fera jamais néanmoins une american " strong " .. on est ok.
Cette édition était la 43 ème de " our special ale ", différente chaque année.
Au menu malt d'orge et de blé. 
Epices certainement puisque " flavored ", mais ce n'est étrangement pas 
indiqué sur l'étiquette.
Mon exemplaire allait donc sur ses trois années de réalisation.
Couleur marron intense aux reflets noir, et opacité forte.
Mousse brun moyen, crémeuse, stable à 3 mm.
Arômes de cannelle, bois de cèdre, bois de santal.
1ère bouche veloutée, à l'entame très épicée, à l'équilibre aléatoire.
Arrière-bouche qui introduit poivre blanc et pointe de muscade.
2ème bouche qui n'est pas du tout à l'équilibre, on est dans l'excès.
Arrière-bouche qui parvient quelque peu à niveler, mais par le bas !!
Longueur qui continue ce nivellement, sans grâce particulière.
Jambes finement huileuses, longues.
Levure correcte.
Alcool beaucoup trop faible pour une christmas, bien que l'âge l'aide un rien.
Finale sans étonnement.
CONCLUSION : n'oublions pas que cette bière est un " one shot " et donc
les cotes rassemblées sous le même nom n'ont absolument aucun sens ..
On ne peut tirer aucun enseignement de pareille statistique !!
Un ami avait apprécié l'édition 2016 .. comme quoi, les années se suivent 
mais sans se ressembler ..  (6/3/5/3/9)

Deep copper colour, tall and durable foram. Sweet smell of roasted bread. Distinc spicy note on the tongue, anis stands out. Very deep, roasty, melanoidine malty taste. Dried fruit deepen the sweetness and give it a noble taste.

Bottle @ DØE Køge. Appearance: pours clear brown with ok off-white soapy head and lacing. aroma/taste: barley, bread, brown sugar, light dried fruit, light liquorice, light cocoa, grass, light citrus, light cinnamon and light spicy notes. palette: strong malty and light  spicy aroma, average carbonation, medium body, medium sweetness, balanced by a light to medium bitterness, average duration and a watery texture. Overall: tasteful winter ale
2018 edition. Brown color, beige head. Aroma of anis and pine. Quite bitter taste, with notes of anis, roasted barley and liquirice. A bit to bitter for a Christmas ale, lacks sweetnes.

Parece una Barley Wine, pero más suave. Notas de palo cortado en nariz y de madera y dátiles en boca, con un punto ácido claro y un amargo algo astringente que la equilibran muy bien. Carácter cálido. Interesante.
mørk brun, treaktig, tørket frukt, krydret..................................
Overwhelming banana aroma, spices gives a feeling of artificial flavour. To sweet.

1.5 litre bottle of the 2019 Edition with friend in Newport Beach. Pours a chestnut brown with a very thick, light brown head. Aroma of caramel and spices. Taste is caramel with notes of nutmeg and cinnamon with hints of ginger and orange. Good bitterness to offset the sweetness of this delicious Christmas Ale. Mouthfeel is OK, but a little thin. This is a pleasant and well-made beer.
2019 edition. Dark amber or even coppery beer with nice beige head. Aroma of caramel, some hops (?). Very malty, moderately sweet with a bit bitter aftertaste.

330ml glass bottle dated as best before xx/xx/xxxx. From Whole Foods Market, Kensington. Served having been out refrigeration for about 15 minutes into a tumbler. 

Deep dark brown, almost touching black. A small finger and a half tan head. Dissipates quickly. 

The aroma is heavily malt driven, molasses, caramel, confectioners sugar and dark dried fruit. Some limited apple. 

The taste is sweet and heavily malty. Dark fruit and molasses. Easily drinkable, similar to a English strong ale. Fruit cake-like. Flavour balance not present but does not diminish the enjoyment.

Sweet in the mouth. Lingering malty, molasses tastes. An unexpected amount of carbonation that is fairly lively. 

Overall, from the small haul of holiday ales I got this festive season, this one is my favourite but also the simplest. A very good beer.
Bardzo fajnie przyprawowe, ale nie słodkie - wytrawne. Sporo suszonych owoców, lekko może karmel. Pełne, gładkie, nisko wysycone. Ale przede wszystkim przyprawowe i wytrawne.
Courtesy of Wojtek from @Carmen24. British ale notes, caramel, molasses, nice dry notes. Easysipping post-Christmas table decoration.
24-12-19 // bottle at home. From Maruhn. Rich malty. Toffee. Dried fruits. Nice.
Brown color, medium sized beige head. Aromas of caramel, dried fruit, wood, nuts and candi sugar. Taste of malt, dried fruit, alcohol, nuts and brown sugar.
Sample from bottle at Holiday Beer Fest. Poured brown/dark amber, off white head. Aroma of spice, caramel, ginger. Taste was mild bittersweet, caramel, hops, spice.

Color negro con reflejos rojizos, opaca. Espuma marfil de dos dedos de espesor y corta retención. Aroma a maltas tostadas, ceniza, leve vino tinto que se va intensificando conforme gana temperatura. Sabor en esa línea, el vino parece más afrutado, como con frutos rojos no bien definidos, leves notas herbales, final medio dulce y ligero amargor herbal, medianamente alcohólica al atemperar. Textura semioleosa. Carbonatación baja.

Esperaba bastante más, hacia la segunda mitad de la cata pierde mucha, casi toda, la chispa, se vuelve plana y aburrida. También esperaba más cuerpo.

Color marrón my oscuro, con destellos rojo rubí a la luz, opaca. Dos dedos de espuma blanco marfil con buena retención. Aroma discreto a malta tostada, ligeros madera quemada, vino tinto y coca cola. Gusto a malta tostada, ligero pino, notas de vino tinto y madera, amargor medio. Cuerpo medio/bajo. Cerveza con muy buen aspecto pero que se queda corta en nariz y boca, me esperaba mucho más.

Bottle. Bier Huis, Ossett. 2019 version. Definitely had this before. Must have been pre my RB days, so 2012 or earlier. Who cares? Clear, deep ruby red. Fine halo of light tan. Nose has Christmas cake fruits. Treacle. Notes of fudge chocolate truffle. Taste is dry, vinous and fruity. Light chocolate bitterness. Medium body. Fine, brisk carbonation. Moderate bitterness to finish, with the cake fruit thing lingering nicely.

Keg at the Star and Garter, Bromley. Copper coloured pour with a beige head. Bonfire toffee,dates,figs,red apple, very nice nose. Taste of red apple,nuts,sweet spice, dried fruit,toffee. Tasty Christmas brew.
Light brown color with a malty and spicy aroma.  Taste is subtlety sweet with a floral crispness, some winter cookie spice.
0,355 l bottle from Systembolaget Nödinge. Beer is ok with some flavours in aroma and taste.

#3515, vintage 2018
Hazy, copper, small white head. Aroma of spruce, juniper, alcohol, needle leaves, nougat, pralines, raisins, almonds, liquer. Taste is neutral to dry, lightly bitter, caramel, juniper, needle leaves, resiny, baked orange, dark chocolate, pralines, noughat, dark fruit, raisins, pomegranate, touch of vanilla, licorice. Medium to fuller body, high carbonation. 
Very rich flavored winter ale. Perfect.
Pours clear dark mahogany with a three finger, beige head.  Aroma hops, molasses and light roast.  Taste is brown sugar, moving to light nutmeg, roast and hops.  Finish is nutmeg, roast and hops.

Bottle 0.355l, vintage 2018. Lightly cloudy, copper colored. AROMA- dark fruit jelly, dark berries, dark grapes, pine, Hašlerky. FLAVOR- dry, moderately bitter, Hašlerky, pine, dark fruit. Medium to fuller bodied. 
Very good.
Bottle from Systembolaget. Pours a amber colour beer with a medium head. Malty with notes of dried fruits, cinnamon and ripe banana. Dry finish.

Couleur rousse très sombre, carbonation légère, bulles fines qui disparaissent vite.
Senteur miel, thym, épices, herbacées avec de légères touches de réglisse sèche.
Palais rond avec une pointe de caramel, parfums de résineux, fruits rouges, la réglisse sèche se précise, malts torréfiés avec une forte amertume en arrière plan, goût fumé, légère pointe de chocolat amer, arômes de muscade, de cannelle et de vanille.
Assurément complexe, elle est agréable à boire en ne laissant pas présager un quelconque degré d'alcool, parfait pour accompagner un plat de viande rouge mais manque toutefois du petit plus qui en fait une bière d'exception, pas le meilleur cru qu'on pourrait attendre d'une brasserie comme Anchor.

Bottled 0,355L. Dark amber/reddish color, moderate creamy white head of medium duration, lively and bubbly impression. Moderate heavy and sweet malty aroma, light aged and vintage fruits aroma, red riped fruits, alcohol. Moderate sweet and heavy malty palate, oily texture, warm and mellow impression, soft carbonation.

Keg at the Euston Tap in 2013. Dark brown with an offwhite head. Aroma of citrus, herbal notes, coriander and brown sugar. Some roasted malt notes in the flavour, with resinous hops. Really nice bitter linger.

12 oz bottle from 2018 season pours a clear chestnut brown with moderate beige head that lingers and leaves a bit of lacing.  Aroma is unusual:  anise, cloves, and some berries are all present.  Taste is slightly sweet and spiced, with some bitterness in the finish. Body is medium with a slightly syrupy mouthfeel.  Yes, it's weird to try a Christmas beer in mid-August, but this one aged well and is much easier to drink than Swedish glogg.
espuma beige bastante cremosa que permanece bien, color marrón rojizo con burbuja muy fina brotando durante la cata, aroma dulce en nariz, sabor con notas maltosas con regusto agradable.
Dark brown pour. Tones of licorice, alcohol, roasted malts. Not sure what to think of this beer, it tastes like ale - stout cross over

Edycja 2018.
Wygląd: Barwa miedziano - rubinowa, przejrzysta z lekką opalizacją. Piana średniej wysokości, drobnopęcherzykowa koloru ecru, opada do ostatniej warstwy nie pozostawiając lacingu. 
Aromat: Słodycz słodowa, miód, melasa, jasne toffi i karmel, tosty, skórka chleba oraz waniliowy akcent. Estry w postaci jabłka, nuty kandyzowanej skórki pomarańczy. Całość uzupełnia kwiatowość chmielowa z lekkimi iglakami, cytrusami.  
Smak: Niestety w porównaniu do aromatu dosyć pusty. Na pierwszy plan delikatnie wysuwa się chmiel, tuż za nim słodowość i estry. W ustach półwytrawne, półpełne, zwiewne. Treściwość w stronę niskiej, wysycenie niskie. Goryczka średnia, żywiczna, średnio - krótka. Finisz wytrawny, żywiczny z nutą skórki jabłka. Pojawia się również delikatne ciepełko alkoholowe. 
Ogólnie: Przyjemny aromat, w smaku niespodziewanie wytrawne i zarazem pustawe. Całość bez specjalnie charakterystycznych nut.

Edycja 2018. Śliczna pianka. Słodki, słodowy aromat z nutami chmielowymi w klimatach cytrusów, białych owoców, iglaków. Niskie nagazowanie; piwo wodniste i gładkie fajne. Goryczka spora, ale zbalansowana - przyjemna. Troszkę brakuje smaku: poza goryczką jest lekko słodowo i chmielowo. Cytrusowo.

Podsumowanie:
Nie jest to typowe Xmas ale - ale piwo jest bardzo fajne.

Bottle.  2012 edition, opened 2019.  Dark chestnut color with a minimal tan head.  Bubbly.  Very sweet nose with spices and molasses.  Similar flavor. Not terribly interesting, falls flat.  Could be the age.  Not sure.

01/28/2018 7/4/8/3/15 3,7/5 0,355l bottle, Vintage 2018, from Damian Bottle Shop, Pours almost clear dark amber to brown liquid, medium creamy tan head, Aroma: typical citrus resiny "Anchor" nose, lemon peel, slightly spicy, subtle caramel, slight roasted malt notes, earthy, Taste: light to medium sweet, medium bitter, light sour, lemon peel, citrus, resin notes, roasted malts, slightly caramel, spices, herbal earthy finish, Palate: medium body, soft to average carbonation, slick mouthfeel, long earthy lemon peel roasted bitter aftertaste, Overall: very good, although expected slightly more. Enjoyed.
12 fl oz bottle, 2016 Xmas Ale. Pours dark brown. Raisin, cinnamon, clove, anise, Christmas pudding, dried cherry, dried fig, prunes. Medium body. Tasty.
ola del flasski best indas handi very nicci des klostrasis derra weltis van dfes kluser

De botella en el Irlandés (edición 2018). Color caramelo tostado, notoria turbidez, espesa corona de espuma blanco marfil. En nariz sorprende el maravilloso olor resinoso, fresco y floral, combinado con recuerdos dulzones a especias, ciruelas y uvas pasas. En boca es carbonatada, se detecta con cierta facilidad el alcohol, toques a malta tostada y un amargor muy curioso, que le da un toque redondo y fresco, la resina muy presente. Excelente winter ale.

Edit versión 2019 en botella: aroma más tostado y menos resinoso que la versión anterior. En boca es menos resinosa, más tostada y chispeante. Sigue conservando la esencia de la Christmas Ale. Muy rica.

Edit versión 2020 en botella: una vuelta de tuerca completa, muy oscura con bonita corona de espuma beige. Aromas a regaliz y especias, recuerda al Jäggermeister. En boca es sedosa y licorosa, fuertes sabores a regaliz, especias tipo clavo y nuez moscada, hollejo. Retrogusto a regaliz. Rica.
Pecan, caramel nose. Clear tea, medium head. Toffee, pecan, subtle hint of coconut. Medium body, easy carbonation.

This years version of the Christmas ale has to be among the best.  For 2018 we have a very dark amber/light brown brew with a decent head that hangs on.  The aroma is spice with some burgundy wine but the flavor is all over that map with some fruit, spice, pine, and more.  Very interesting brew this year and hope they keep this up for years to come. (some of the ones in the past was not all that great.)

It pours light brown with deep reddish hues. The head is tan with excellent head retention. The aroma starts off with a bit of spiciness and toffee. As it warms there are some dark cherry notes. There are also additional pine notes in the background with bread crusts. The flavor is highlighted by the spices and the malts. The malts resemble toffee and bread. There are some piney notes in support with dried cherry. It has a moderately full body with a somewhat dry finish. Overall, it is a malty and spicy beer just perfect for the New Year.
A very nice Christmas ale. Full of dark rich malt, a little fruitiness and spice. Feels very warming on a winter’s night.

Pours clear brown with beige head. Ok persistency.  Malt dominates the aroma. High bitterness with additional spices. Piney, Resiny hop flavor, a hint of spices in the aroma/flavor. Base beer is closest to American strong ale with some spices. A good Xmas beer
I only get around to this brew every few years.  2018 is especially good.  Wonderful balance of malt, spices and hops.  Just a great fireside supper.

bottiglia 355 ml 2018 edition, 6.9 % ABV, schiuma fine pannosa beige persistente, color mogano limpido, al naso lieviti spezie zucchero di canna pino note erbacee, in bocca lievito caramello spezie zucchero di canna, lieve acidula, corpo rotondo, carbonazione moderata, amaro accentuato piacevole e lungo nel finale. Una birre delle feste fresca molto piacevole. 27.12.18
Aromat żywica, estrowosc. Smak troche czerwonych owoców, mało słodyczy. Fajne

Pours muddy brown with a thin tan head. Aroma of malt mixed with a variety of spices. Taste has a malt backbone accented by herbal notes, sage and grassy notes. Palate includes a mix of spices, as though it is a very light take on a belgian. Interesting beer.
Bottle left by BelgianBeerGal for us to enjoy at Christmas. Hazy brown. Spices, raisins, some toffee. Not bad.

2018:
Aroma: caramel, toast, piney, herb, some orange peel
Appearance: clear dark brown with a one-finger tan head.
Taste: caramel, toast, pine, nutmeg, some citrus, medium-high bitterness, medium-low sweetness.
Palate: medium-high body, medium carbonation, dry finish, medium-high alcohol sensation
Overall: spicy flavors blend in well. nice choice for a winter night.

Nice, bright aroma, pine, sweet malts, fruit, and spices. Hazy muddy brown, which changes to a dull ruby with a back-light.  Relatively short, light tan head,  dropping fairly quickly, leaving some stringy lacing and a very bubbly cap and ring. Initial taste is dry, but it becomes sweet right away. Feel is medium. A nice flavor; lightly spiced, tastes like a Christmas tree (fresh and airy, but not resiny), a slight bitterness in the middle and finish. The overall taste is nicely malty with a dry finish and aftertaste. Light touch with the spices, flavor of  fruits, with also a light touch with the hops. Piney in the evergreen sense, less so in the resin sense.
I preferred last years offering to be honest,but this is still nice.Quite sour tasting,but decent,and anchors signature bubblegum flavour stays true.

2018 versie : Zoetig. Kruidig, zoethout/ziltig. Wat karamel zoet en vol genoeg. 2017 versie er achteraan gehad....die is veel beter. 3.5 punten voor deze.

2017 versie: Kruidenbitter achtig. Vol... spicy. Beetje koffie en choco. Deze geef ik 4 punten! Zeer goed! Veel voller en meer roasty.

12oz bottle.  2018.  Pours a bronzed brown with a tiny off-white head - nice color but a weak head/head color.  Aroma is caramel, nuts, spruce, fig, licorice, toast, some cocoa, slight bubblegum, and a little berry.  Taste is caramel, nuts, dark fruit (fig with just a little bit of plum, I think) licorice, light pine, earth, roast, and toffee.  A little bitter nutmeg lingers.  Medium body.  Moderate+ carbonation.  Sticky, slightly syrupy mouthfeel.  Not into the taste on this one, but the aroma is very nice.  ABV is listed as 6.9% on the bottle.

edycja 2018 Zapach: cytrusowe, żywiczne, cukierkowe, estrowy, lekko kwiatowy, umiarkowanie intensywny i na świąteczny ALE dobry. Smak: czerwone owoce, przyjemna umiarkowana dosyć długa fajna goryczka, lekka karmelowość, nuta palona i lekka cytrusowość na finiszu. Całkiem przyjemna piwo świąteczne bez męczących goździków czy innych nachalnych dodatków.

2018 version, 355ml bottle from Cotteridge Wines. Pours clear dark copper brown with an off white head. Aroma: rich malts, caramel, brown sugar, herbal hints. Taste: moderate to heavy sweet & light to moderate bitter, rich malts, dark fruits, candy sugar, christmas spices, hoppy hints. Medium body, average carb, lightly warming sweet-ish finish

Bottle, Anchor Brewing Merry Christmas Happy New Year 2018, 6.9%. Color: Clear copper, off-white head. Aroma: Malt, caramel, herbal notes. Taste: Malt, caramel, sugary, subtle notes of dark fruit, notes of herbs like coriander and nutmeg. Floral notes. Slightly candy-like but not in a bad way. Medium sweet, moderate bitter and slightly sourish. Somewhat more bitterness at finish, with hints of coffee. Smooth mouthfeel. Below average carbonation, above medium body. Pretty easy drinkable, yet a nice winter warmer. Let Christmas come...

12 oz bottle, labeled "Merry Christmas and Happy New Year". Smells of malt and coffee. Dark brown in color. Tastes of malt, coffee, with a touch of bitter. Has a chocolaty and coffee finish. Kind of like a stout, but not as thick.
Taste was nutmeg, cinnamon, dark fruit, malty, raisins, and bready. Dark reddish brown in color. Smells of cinnamon and nuts.
Bottle from Wegman’s, clear dark orange brown.  Caramel aroma, toasted malt and dark fruit taste.  Malty finish with hops underneath.

2018 edition 6.9%. Perfume aroma, which reminds me of a fragrant fruit such as Yuzu.  The flavour is rich, purfemy, malty and has a lot of caramel as well as coriander, notes of cinnamon and nutmeg.  Very sweet,  sugary finish. This is a heavy, quite fruity ale which justifies its winter release

Miedziane piwo o średniej pianie, która pozostaje do końca w formie pierścionka przy brzegu szkła. Aromat karmelowy, leśny, trochę truskawek i cytrusów. W smaku lekko karmelowe, przyprawowe, leśne. Goryczka średnia. Ogólnie całkiem udane piwo świąteczne,ciekawsze niż większość, gdzie tylko przyprawy czy miód lub ewentualnie czekolada.

Bottle pour. Caramel and prune aroma. First sip has notes of grape and bubble gum. Fades quickly to bitterness and to me is a overboiled but that is Anchors approach. Once the bitterness goes the malty aftertaste is good.

12oz bottle. 9/24/18 bottle date. Appearance:    deep brown with ruby red highlights. Clear, with great lacing. 
Aroma:  Rich toasted malt and bread crust and some light nuttiness. 
Taste:  Strong toasted malt and bread crust maltiness. Caramel shows up on the backside with a touch of tartness, almost black cherry like. Bitterness is moderate. 
Mouthfeel:  Medium bodied with a moderate carbonation. 
Finish:  Malt forward on the finish with some lingering toast, along with some light tartness
Overall:  A Malt forward, toasty, caramel flavored ale with a heavier body for a nice winter warmer type flavor without the high alcohol. Beautiful ruby red color
An american, brown / black Spice Beer with light brown head. Aroma is caramel, light liqourice, light coffee, light berries. Taste is bitter. Starts sweet and dry finish.

Aroma of caramel, malt, fruits and hints of chocolate, dried fruits and pine. Dark brown with a tan head, Meium + sweet and medium bitter. Medium + body with average carbonation. Overall a OK brew. A bit unbalanced, but still fairly drinkable.

As Anchor Brewing Merry Christmas Happy New Year 2017, 6.7% ABV.

Bottle, 0.355l. Deep ruby, almost black pour. One finger creamy brown head, long lasting. Thick lacing as it goes down. Strong malty herbal nose, caramel, cake, notes of cocoa and herbal liquor.

Medium body, soft carbonation. Regular texture, slightly prickly. Roasty bittersweet taste and aroma. Aroma of caramel, toffee, candy and cake. Roasty. Herbal liquor, slightly boozy. Bubblegum aftertaste, drying mouthfeel. Medium to long finish, mildly bitter and dry.

Overall, quite tasty. Rich and fairly complex, this is one quality brew.
barwa ciemnego bursztynu. W aromacie piernikowe przyprawy, cynamon, goździki. W smaku bardzo ziołowe, przyjemne

Malty, sweet, slightly roasted, dark fruit, some alcohol. Pitch black color with small sized brown head. Sweet malty taste, biscuity, cake, boozy. Medium body, soft carbonation. Nice chocolate aftertaste. //bottle from Pivoteka, 2017 version

Wersja 2014
Piana drobna powoli opada, zdobi szkło. Kolor ciemny z mętnymi rubinowymi prześwitami. Aromat świeże czerwone owoce truskawka granat, nuty korzenne cynamon, anyż, piernik, przyjemny. Smak, wytrawne, czekolada, przyprawy korzenne aż ostre w smaku. Generalnie dziwne zaskakuje wysokim odfermentowaniem i brakiem jakiejkolwiek słodyczy. Dobre, pachnie ciekawiej

2017 version. Bottle from Pivoteka. Lost rating from April 13th. Very dark brown body, blackish, with a lasting tan head. Full malty aroma, sweetish and nutty. Malty taste, again dry and full, light bitterish touches, just vagueliy herbal/piney, ending a bit watery. Okay beer, expected more.

Version 2017.

Robe noire surmontée d'une belle mousse beige bien persistante et crémeuse. Arômes, fumés, réglisse, café, fruits noirs, épices. Goût fumé, chocolat, café, réglisse, épices, fruits noirs. Les épices (je dirais canelle, muscade, clou de girofle) restent en bouche avec le fumé. Texture plutôt crémeuse, carbonatation fine.
Bon dosage des épices, bonne bière de Noël.

Version 2017 dégustée, une bière très sombre avec une mousse couleur caramel. Des parfums légèrement chocolat et des saveurs torréfiées, un peu amères, très agréables en bouche tout comme la texture. Je pensais presque boire un stout.

This is sort of like a dark lager, but has some characteristics of a porter and dunkel. Appears a dark dark brown, but isn't very heavy. I am tasting chocolate, caramel, and coffee malts....maybe a little toffee too? All those nice holiday spices with what appears to be spruce, but only mild. A light hop finish to balance it all out. An all-around solid brew.
Mörkt brun, nästan svart. Plommon i doften. Choklad, rostad säd i smaken. Rätt torr, måttlig beska på slutet.
Arômes d'épices et de chocolat léger. Robe sombre et mousse légère et persistante. Attaque sur des épices, du caramel et du réglisse. Langueur légèrement alerte sur du houblon. Pas mal !

From 16 ounce Prowler bought at Liquor Shed bought at Liquor Shed in Casper. 2017.

Pours near black, tiniest bit of red hues. Great head of foam with good lacing. 

Smells of nutmeg, almost like what you get with a pumpkin beer, bananas, cloves, roasted malt.

Taste has the nutmeg, cloves, bananas, kinda roasty, very low level of bitterness. Very tasty. 

Great mouthfeel, easy drinking, excellent from this mini Growler. Bottles won't be coming so I am glad Jacob got some and put it on the Growler station.

Bottle. Pours very dark ruby with a minimal head. Aroma of Christmas spices, gingerbread. Taste is dry with a noticeable bitterness. Flavors slight red fruit, orange peel, slight dark malt? Medium body, slick texture, high carbonation.
Nah, it just didn't do it for me, though I'm not a fan of the style, I guess.
Arômes de caramel, vanille, réglisse rouge.  Robe brune foncée et opaque. En bouche, légère amertume liée à la torréfaction.
Aus der Flasche 2016-01 getrunken. Nicht wirklich meins, spannend war nur der deutliche Kakaogeschmack.

Talking of the 2017 version, it tastes very similar to Anchor Porter, to me, except a little stronger. The extra strength gives it a bit more alcohol on the nose. It has wheat in it but I can't detect that difference from the porter. It's an intense drink, this, with strong hoppiness added to the alcohol, yeast, and coffee flavours. There's a touch of sweetness in it, but not enough to stop it being a harsh one, in my opinion. Good but challenging.

Pours a very dark brown, almost black with a big, mocha head. Aroma is sweet milk chocolate, some subtle spice. Taste is some sweet chocolate, spice up front, leading to an even spicier middle, some fruitiness, ending lightly bitter Medium to low carbonation, medium to full bodied. Very nice!

2017 version at 6.7% abv. Pours opaque black with a huge light brown head that shows good retention and very nice lacing. Aroma shows a clean mix of roasted malts and coffee, slight toffee and spiciness. Overall not so complex, but very clean and quite strong. Taste follows the aroma with a good balance of sweet and bitter notes and a slightly bitter, dry finish. Roasted malts, coffee, and a plesant warming/spicy feel. Medium bodied with low to medium carbonation, overall quite soft in the mouth. In short, a well made robust porter with a delicate warming/spicy feel. Nice one.

Feb 2018 - 355ml bottle at home in Richmond as 'Anchor Brewing Merry Christmas Happy New Year 2017', 6.7%, BB Sep 2019. Pours an opaque black with a huge foamy brown head that leaves thick streaky lacing. Aroma is yeasty and metallic and also cocoa, little fudgey, milky coffee, chocolate digestive biscuit. Body is rounded, smooth with soft carbonation. Taste is malty, dates, raisins, little metallic, yeasty, breathy figs and nutmeg, mixed Christmas spice. Carbonation is soft in mouth but a little gassy on the stomach. Quite a tasty beer on the whole. Good. (7-4-6-3-14=3.4)
Fles 35,5cl thuis. Bitter, redelijk krachtig maar ook zoettonen, pruim, licht drogig. (5-2011).

2016 version. Sweet aroma of spices. A lot of stuff in the kind of candied tangerine, ginger bread, cinnamon rolls and cardamon. Very pleasant at all. Dark brown-ish in the glass with a medium head. Taste is semi dry with notes of orange fruit peel, some albedo, spicy back with cinnamon. Finish is bit roasty, beer is minimal overcarbonated, but still different than the other xmas beer stuff.
Bottle, 355 ml, courtesy of JFK10000. Shared with him and Max. Dark brown, medium beige head. Chocolate, bit spicy, caramel, sweet, medium bodied. Bitter finish.

2015 bottle. All reviews lately are 2016 and later. No date on bottle, except for the 2015 on the label. Shame. If it’s different each year then my thoughts are redundant. It’s pretty good. That’s all I got.

Czarne z czapą beżowej piany. Dość duże wysycenie, piwko syczało sążnie przy nalewaniu. W aromacie mix biszkoptu, anyżu i mieszanki przypraw. Gładki posmak z nutą przyprawowej ostrości na finiszu, pozostawia po sobie garbnikowy posmak, będąc jednocześnie słodkawe.

Sunday, January 14, 2018. 2017 Bottle, 355mL. 6.7%. Purchase ("La Cervoiserie", @Poitiers, FR). Home. A black opaque beer with a big beige foamy head ; average retention ; ok lacing. Roasted, cinnamon(+), caramel notes, prune notes, some licorice. Light sweet, light dry refreshing spicy, bitter note. Medium body, thin texture, soft gaseous, dry refreshing spicy finish. Overall, correct ; slightly disappointing.

Anchor Christmas ale fra 2014, drukket januar 2018. Har altså ligget 3 år i kælderen. Vinøs, næsten sherryagtig i næsen, lakrids og blomme. Går igen i smagen, sammen med lidt grannål fra humlen. En dejlig juleøl der ikke er spor klistret eller sød. Flot øl. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Aromas of dark dried fruits (plum, black currents); winter/pumpkin pie spices (nutmeg,cinnamon, clove, allspice) aromas are clear but not overwhelming.

Color is black; even the edges are very dark brown. Medium sized tan head. 

Taste is fairly dry and fairly bitter. 

Medium bodied; carbonation is somewhat lively. Finish is fairly long, with dried fruit, winter spices, carbonation and a dry finish.

Overall this is a pretty good beer. It has some complexity with spice, roasted flavors, dried fruits; the overall dryness and lively carbonation work well with beer.

Aroma: spicy and herbal, nutmeg.
Appearance: Brown color and creamy head.
Taste: spicy, nutmeg, roasted dark malts, spruce, cola, herbal, rather dry.
Palate: medium body and medium carbonation.
Overall: no idea what should I expect. A decent beer.
2017 edition. Darker than expected. A little thin but tasty. A bit spicy, quite bitter. Decent depth. A good but not stunning effort.
Aroma of cola, roasty malt, licorice, holiday spices.  A brown color, fairly clear but dark, and with a frothy, brown head. The flavor was medium sweet.   Medium body, smooth, creamy texture

2015 Edition. 355mL bottle BBE: 08.2017. Served in a tulip glass @ 16ºC. Pours a deep, dark, almost black body with a medium, tight, creamy, tan head giving complete coverage with moderate lacing. Medium intensity aroma, dominated by a rich, sweet, caramelised, treacle toffee smell, and livened by plum, pine needles and bran flakes. Hints of liquorice. To taste, a suggestion of fruity acidity is replaced by a lasting, medium burnt toffee sweetness, savoury notes and dry oak. Medium bodied with a creamy finish, medium-high carbonation and a soft liquorice candy finish. An interesting beer in great condition, just dominated a little too much by a treacle toffee flavour. Otherwise flawless. Cheers and a Happy New Year to Craig for the bottle.

2017. 6.7%. Black. Mineral sweetness.mild chocolate.Taste is roast char. Acidic bitter. Bordering astringent. Acidic stout like. Minerally bitter. Like a dubble , stout but more stout or heavy Porter. Doubt I would care for a sixer of this.
2016 bottle. Dark appearance with light brown foam. Taste is burnt, twiggy, spicy, liquorice. Decent but I expected a bit more.

Bottle of 2017 vintage, bought at Best One, Bedford, drunk at home. Rich dark brown with purplish hue. Opaque with a wisp of khaki head. Spruce, allspice, oak, a touch of molasses. Bittersweet taste with earthy hops asserting at the end. Woody and slightly astringent finish with liquorice and medicinal herbs in the aftertaste. Highly carbonated. A brilliant beer.

Bottled 355ml. -from Pivoteka Zagreb as Anchor Christmas Ale 6.7%ABV. Almost black coloured, medium sized pale beige head, chocolate and alcohol in the nose. Moderate sweet malty, caramel, light chocolate, cardammome, touch of caramel and cinnamon with mild spicy finish. Nothing more nothing less than ok.

Bottle. 6.7%. Best before end 08.19. 2017 version. Pours a dark reddish chestnut brown, with a tan head. Great lacing. Sweet, slightly tart, dark fruit aroma. Note of berries/cherries and a light spicy note. Malt in the background. Hint of licorice as it warms. Flavour is dark fruits with a light, dusty overtone, and a licorice bitterness. Spices in the background. Roasted, bitter finish. Notes of coffee and spices. Mild alcohol burn. Lingering grassy note. A wee bit too much carbonation. Overall good, but a bit cloying. 29.12.17.
(noire stout, nez stout & agrumes confits, bouche stout à tendance IPA, forte, pour un noël masculin !)
Moderate malty aroma. Brown in color with massive long lasting light brown head. Taste is malty with moderate spice notes

Wyraźne aromaty przyprawowe, korzenna, trochę aromatów słodowych, opiekanych, melanoidnowych. W smaku lekka pełnia, trochę słodyczy, również sporo przypraw, trochę nut słodowych, goryczka średnia, lekko opiekana. Dość smukłe.

8 mois avant DLC. Brune presque noire. Ni carbo ni mousse. Arôme agréable de cerise/caramel et malts grillés. En bouche, caramel,  malt grillés,  cacao, et houblonnage herbacé. Pointe café également avec pas mal d'épices.  Je trouve l'ensemble déséquilibré et le houblonnage qui prend trop de place. Pas enchanté pour cette bière qui est pourtant bien notée.

2017 edition. Black with nice lacy head. Nice velvety body, chocolate almond with some sweetness. Smooth and great in winter.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
14/20 really enjoyed the wackiness of this beer - very unusual taste - ale with almonds, quite malty but with sweetness.

2017er Flasche, tolles Design, ich liebe die Idee mit den jährlich wechselnden Bäumen. In der Nase Röstmalz. Im Trunk frisch, würzig, dann mittig Röstmalz. Supergut trinkbar, dürfte aber gern mehr Bumps haben.
Great aroma out of the bottle. However, the first sip is pine-heavy. The after taste is a bit reminiscent of an English bitter. Malts take a back seat this year.

12 oz bottle. Pours dark, dark brown with a big micro-bubble tan head with lots of lacing. Scents of coffee, chocolate and malt. Nice big malty coffe and taost tastes. Some sweet with a slightly sharp short balanced finish. Dry mouthfeel and medium carbonation. I like it. Ho ho ho.

Botella de 2017. Color marrón oscuro, casi negro, opaco, con capa de espuma marrón de tres dedos de grosor y buena retención. Carbonatación media. Textura oleosa y ligeramente efervescente. Aroma a Coca-Cola, especias, metal, chocolate negro. En boca hay recuerdos de Coca-Cola, dark fruits, muchas especias, clavo, canela, cardamomo, jengibre, chocolate negro, ligerísimo licor al final del trago, con algo de amargor. Postgusto especiado. Bien pero tampoco me dice demasiado. 6/4/7/3=13................................................................................................. Botella 2018. Color ámbar, rojizo si le da la luz, translúcido, con capa de espuma de un blanco ligeramente amarillento de dos dedos de grosor y muy buena retención. Bonito lacing. Carbonatación media visualmente. Textura acuosa con chispeo. Aroma a caramelo, terroso, cobre, algo floral muy de fondo. En boca hay caramelo, tierra, cobre, recuerdos florales y herbales. Escaso dulzor. Escaso amargor al final del trago. Caramelo y tierra en regusto y postgusto. Cumple como Amber Ale pero tampoco ilusiona. 6/4/6/3=13.

2017 version.  Bottle from Blue Max, Burnsville, MN.  There is a small off-white head and medium lacing. Sweet and spicy aroma. Thin dark brown.  Fruit taste with hint of winter spice and pine. Mild hop finish. Just a slight "piney" note to make this a fine Christmas selection.

Bottle 2017 vintage @ 6.7% from Bier Huis, Ossett and drunk in hotel, Wakefield after the annual Christmas family gathering. Black beer with medium tan head. Aroma of liquorice, dark malts, toffee and dark fruit. Taste is spice, Sweetish dark malts, dried dark fruit, liquorice and molasses. Medium bodied. Very good.

Hælder mahogni amber, med tyk off white skum. Klar væske 
Dufter af pine, og er præget af mellemristet kaffe i smagen. 
Der er en fin humlet bitterhed
medium body, lidt for tynd, average carbonation, fin kaffeish finish

Fin øl til at nyde foran pejsen,
Little head and medium lacing. Sweet and spicy aroma. Thin dark brown aroma. Tart fruit taste with hint of winter spice. Mild hop finish

Aromas a tostado y canela y cacao
Bien aspecto caoba oscuro espuma persistente
En boca compleja cacao torrefacto y especiada 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
kinda watery, but then a weird miz of sweet tart and somewhat bitter at end. licorice, cocacola, spices
medium mokka coloured head, black coloured body, fruity pine tree peach like smell, some sweet malts brett yeasts like taste dark malts chocolat like taste

0.33 l bottle shared with Anna Bog. Thanks! Dark brown, lasting small tan head. Spicy aromas, roasty, nutty, chocolate. Dry. Nice use of spices. Medium body, moderate carbonation, light finish. Tasty.

Black in color with a dark reddish brown hue. A calico colored head of creamy foam on top. A perfect blend of wintery spices like cinnamon, clove, and dried citrus fruit. Drinks like a black IPA with some roasted barley and a perfect finishing pine forest hop revelation. Christmas on a dreary night is what this ale speaks of. Beautiful, dank, and dark.
Pours jet black with a browny white head.  Nut and spice aroma. Coffee taste. Very nice ale

Dark brown to black colored, medium+ frothy tan head, not all that lasting. Aroma is of malt, dark chocolate, roasty, spices, aniseed?, toasty, bit bready. Taste is medium sweet malt, chocolate and roasted malt, spices, toasty, some caramel, bready, licorice, light orange peel?, medium roasty bitterness, dryish finish. Medium bodied, soft+ carbonation, bit creamy. 
(bottle 2017, Pivoteka, Zagreb)

I thought this was a very nice winter seasonal. The warm spices and the rich base beer worked together well. I got lots of clove and some allspice which made me want pumpkin pie or cranberry sauce to go with it.

Bottle from systembolaget. Aroma is deep and thick but no overall master flavour. The apperance, dark with a lovely stout like coffee style fizz. The taste is much darker than most christmas ales, more like a stout. Smoke, dark malts, burnt wood charcol. Not a massive fan of this ale/stout hybrid flavour.  (5/12/17)
---
Bottle from Systembolaget. Wasn't aware I had had this before. Ah well. Sweet lakrits in the nose. Lovely apperance with a lasting foam. Sweet lakrits and malt in the taste. Some cola in there. Much preferred this time round, a nice rather unique tasting christmas beer. 2.9 to 3.2.

2017: Dark, almost black colour with a tan head.
Aroma: liquorice, some caramel, malt, earthy notes, some wood and spices. 
Taste: liquorice, salt, roasted malt, plums, a little cacao, some sweetness.

2018: Dark brown, creamy head. 
Aroma: spices, caramel malt, plum, marmalade. 
Taste: spices, liquorice, roasted malt, some caramel malt. A little watery.

2019: Dark colour, almost black. Creamy head.
Aroma: caramel, brown sugar, spiced, plums,  malt.
Taste: spices, burnt malt, brown sugar, liquorice, molasses, some pine.

2020: Black colour, creamy tan head.
Aroma: spruce, caramel, cream, bark,some molasses. Wow.
Taste: bitter roasted malt, coffee, some dark chocolate, spruce, brown sugar, some banana.

Smell is of tobacco...some chocolate maybe...dark malt mostly...taste is dark malt with a light bitterness...some complexity...lightly bitter finish...meh..had at casual pint with Megan, John and the young crew 12/1/17 to 12/4/21 the recipe changes year to year apparently so I'll try and keep a running score...'17 rating a 2.9...'21 rating: smell is like warm sweet cinnamon, but taste is quite different and unique...seems like a mix of sweet cinnamon, black pepper and medium roasted malt...complex, flavorful, mouthfeel just a bit empty... definitely not sweet..just lots of spices..only gave palate a 1 point boost...had at home on a lazy Saturday the day after Liz cooked a wonderful vegan broccoli and pasta dinner with chibada(?) Bread and bruschetta 🥰🥰 and bought me a meteorite!! Pandemic still carries on amongst the unvaxxed with ~778k US deaths...
C-. Pours a dark brown color with khaki head. The after taste is not pleasant.

A spice beer bug hiding more depth than your typical pumpkin offering. Ginger cinnamon and fennel come through with notes of molasses and other dark fruits, and the roasted male holds up to those additions nicely. Not my personal favorite, but really well done for a spice. Only misstep is they could have brought mire hoppy pine bites in with the right finishing hops. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

2017 bottle. A bit of a pleasant surprise, not as heavily spiced and overbearing as most Winter Warmers, more herbal and dry than a liquid gingerbread cookie. Seems hoppier than the last OSA I drank--granted, it was several years ago--and comes across far more invested in bright green pine, anise, and juniper notes (maybe spruce tips) with an underlying malt sweetness that mixes caramel-slathered bread with mild hefe hints of banana and clove. Finishes bready and bittersweet. Definitely grows on you as it warms. Good year to buy a sixer.

12floz bottle, 2017 edition (I didn't bother to check to convert date code to mm.dd.yyyy format), $1.75 unit cost, mug glass. I've had this beer many times through its releases. Sometimes I've even aged a few for a year to no detrimental nor incremental affect on quality (spice notes tend to smooth out, never went beyond a year). Well as with previous editions, this beer is similar - dark with a moderate amount of tan head, notes of cardamon, cinnamon, toasted malt, black licorice prevail in aroma and taste, all set to brown porter base that is medium in body. I'm detecting more of the spice notes than in prior experience. I chalk it up to my impression at the moment, which is to say less favorable than other times. Reviewed as 3.6, but this could fluctuate based on past/future experience and circumstances as much as +/- 0.5 points (this can be said for many beers, but this one especially). All that be said, I consider this to be a good holiday beer that I once considered to be an exotic beer.

2016 bottle. Big light browned head, but fast flattering.
Nose : dried fruit, liquorous, alcohol
Aroma : dry roasted malt, mid malt
Light bitter, dry, thin body
Almost flat.

Butelka V.2016 trochę wyleżana. Jednak za każdym razem jest podobnie... pierwszy łyk i w uszach pojawia się u mnie "Jingle Bell Rock" Bobbiego Helmsa. Magiczny koc w kratę owija mnie od stóp do pasa a telewizor zamienia się w skwierczący ciepłem kominek. Jedno z moich ulubionych piw zimowo/jesiennych.
Niech już będą święta!

Our Special Ale pours a very dark brown color with a frothy beige head of short to medium life span. If the head had dissipated a little more slowly, this brew would have been very beautiful. The bouquet is somewhat savory and has notes of prunes, pine, and Worcester sauce while the malt has the aroma of fruit bread, which carries over to the sweet attack. The well balanced mid-palate is less savory than the nose suggests and the layered mix of dried dark fruits, roast, and pine resin notes is very pleasant. It leaves a long finish with notes of German dark bread crust on the palate. Damn, this is good beer.

Botella 33 cl en el Lúpulo Oviedo diciembre 2011. Edición 2010. Fcpref 09..2012. (r2111). Maltosos muy especiados, recuerdos de anises y algunos enebros. Cuerpo medio fino, espumoso. 5.5 vol suaves. Original.

2015 vintage. Pours mahogany from the bottle. The crown is thick and frothy. Aroma is toffee, red berry, port wine. Taste is a bit tart, mildly bitter, spicy, oddly void of sweetness given the aroma, weird. Body approaches being medium, but also oddly thin at times. Interesting, but it failed to grow on me.

2009 vintage. Intense plums and dry cake. Bready grainy body with dry dried fruits - cherries and plums, Round with no bitterness and a moderate sweetish malty aroma in the and. Very round, but probably too long matured.

2016 bottle, 12C. Very dark brown with a light tan head that fades to a coat. Aroma of strong bread, brown sugar, dried banana, spices - mace, nutmeg etc. Spices are by no means domineering. A bit lighter bodied than expected. Only a little sweet with bread, dried fruit and spices before a modestly bitter finish. Very nice with subtle depth, but hoped for a little bit more grunt for 6.5%
Vintage 2016 Bottle from saveur Bière. Warm summer nigth and winter beer.. It works! Exellent complex dried fruit aroma, winter spices taste. Good

Popped the cap and unleashed a real spice bomb of an ale. It borders on a dense perfume aroma with no traditional ale scents present. A course, thick body with a thin finish. This was a bottle from the 2016 vintage, 6.5% ABV. Maybe 2016 was a bad recipe but I don’t anticipate buying this again.

Malt blend gives off that dry fruit and molasses. Comes through with the festive spirit. Gets better when warms up a bit.

Reviewed - A Brew With You, Ep. 64
Bottle 2010 - pours brown with tan head - nose and taste of molasses, toffee, caramel, spice - medium body

Birra dal colore scuro, schiuma beige, fine e non persistente. Al naso sentori di caffe, malto tostato, caramello e spezie. Al palato moderatamente corposa con note di caffe, toffe e coriandolo. Nel finale rimane dolce e abbastanza stucchevole. In ogni caso una buona birra.

Voici une belle surprise avec cette Merry Christmas 2016 Happy New Year de chez Anchor. Même si le titrage alcoolique est un peu faible (6,5% Abv) pour une bière hivernale et que celui-ci aurait gagné à être augmentée pour renforcer la puissance de la bière, celui-ci est bien utilisé pour résultat une bière harmonieuse, juste et agréable. L’étiquette présente une approche un peu différente des classiques, avec une nouvelle année sous le signe de la renaissance et du symbole de l’arbre pour le solstice d’hiver. Je vais être plus terre à terre et m’intéresser à notre breuvage qui doit être avant tout festif ! En verre, notre Anchor, présente une belle robe d’un brun profond et se pare d’une multitude de fines bulles la rendant des plus gracieuses. Une mousse beige, nappe convenablement la bière de 3 à 5 mm d’épaisseur. Le nez est très beau se portant sur la cerise, le pruneau et le café sur de jolies notes épicées de réglisse et de cannelle procurant une sensation de vin chaud. L’attaque sur le malt, le caramel et le réglisse est un peu en dedans mais prépare bien l’entrée en matière de l’amertume qui est douce sur des notes de café. L’arrière bouche s’intègre quant à elle parfaitement bien, soyeuse sur des arômes de cerise et de candi. L’ensemble est très chaleureux et parfaitement homogène. Le final laisse quant à lui s’exprimer des notes de cherry avec des belles variations autour de la réglisse. La longueur, malgré les 6,5 % Abv est très correct. En conclusion, il s’agit ici d’une très belle bière qui brille par son équilibre. Avec un peu plus de puissance et un brin de complexité en plus, je ne serai pas resté sur terre...je serai monté sur le pin!

Treated as a winter warmer, this was poured into a mug.
The appearance was a dark brown close to black color with a great looking two finger white to off white foamy head. Slowly dissipates. Mild stringy lacing.
The aroma leads with malty rich milk chocolate, and then subtle dark chocolate. Some graham cracker, subtle cinnamon, and vanilla also make a decent presence, ends with some dark fruits and brown sugar.
The flavor leans to the sweet side combining all of those notes of the aroma. Nicely blended aftertaste of all of those components of the aroma into the finish.
On the palate, this one sat about a light to medium on the body. Nice sturdy "winter" body. Moves malty sweet over my tongue. Rich and smooth.
Overall, well done as always by Anchor, looking forward to age several of these. However, it’s too malty as an American Strong ale. I think it’s mislabeled. It should be a Winter Warmer.
Earlier Rating: 8/11/2014 Total Score: 3.9
2012 bottle reviewed in December of 2012 (sorry for the late review).
This was initially poured into a pint glass but later had in a snifter. The only differences I noticed was the head was a bit messier and spottier along with the smells lasting just a tad longer in the snifter than the pint glass. Here’s the rest.
The appearance was a murky brown color (honestly, it kinda reminded me of brown sludge). Anyways, no hit, because I work with sludge from time to time, I guess I’m just too used to it. One finger white foamy head dissipated in both glasses at a nice pace.
The smells bitter cocoa bean, sweet licorice with a light ginger, and cinnamon and then allowing a decent allspice to come in.
The taste was sweet, slightly bitter and having a decent Christmas spice to round things out a bit. Eventually an earthiness does come out.
On the palate, this one sat right at a medium on the body. Sessionable, I was hoping, but showing a decent sipping quality about it.
Overall, though the recipe almost always seems to vary every year, I can almost never pass this up year after year.

Very good. The nose is so rich, so fruity, so complex. Really smells like a much heavier brew, so an excellent weekday brew. Taste is great as well, but there it reveals the relatively low alcohol a bit. Nonetheless, excellent!

I det närmaste svart med ljusbrunt, tätt, medelstort skum. Maltig doft med inslag av russin, julkryddor (kardemumma, kryddnejlika) och lite dova apelsintoner. Fyllig maltig smak med torkad frukt (russin, dadlar), lite apelsin och kardemumma och kryddnejlikor, fin sötma som balanseras av en lite avslutande beska av riktigt mörk choklad. En suverän julöl, smakrik med trevlig kryddighet och fin balans mellan i sötman.

Mycket mörkt rödbrun med medelstort, beiget skum. Doftar mörk limpa, pomerans, russin och kryddor. Rostad smak, lite choklad och mörk kola, russin, lite kryddor. Doftar väldigt gott men smaken är lite tunnare än förväntat, dock en riktigt trevlig julöl.

Pours black with frothy tan head. Aroma dark chocolate and clove. Taste medium sweet and a little umami. Palate medium body, sticky texture, soft carbonation, long finish. Bottle (labeled Christmas Ale 2016); pours dark brown with a beige head; aroma of spices, molasses, and malt; taste is sweet with spice, caramel, molasses, and malt; finish is dry with some spice

Hatalmas, tartós, barna hab, sötétbarna szín. Édeskés, fűszeres illat. Pörkölt malátás, karácsonyi fűszeres, de szerencsére nem vitték túlzásba, egész jó lett. Közepesen szénsavas, enyhén kesernyés, egy picit lehetne testesebb. Könnyed karácsonyi sör, nem rossz, de nem is nyűgözött le.
One of my favorite beer! Pours gold colour beer with a medium head. Well-balanced!
Jouluinen haju, väri syvän tumman ruskea, valkoinen vaahto. Maku hieman vetinen, mutta karvas. Haju makua parempi.
12 oz pour into tulip. Dark, opaque, moderate tan head. Nose is spiced, sweet, gingerbread. Palate is creamy and smooth. Taste echos nose with a dry, bitter finish. Maybe a little flat taste, though.
Bottle. Dark amber color. Aroma: malt, caramel and wine, spices. Similar taste: sweet and spicy, carmel, malt, a little watery.

Incredibly soft mouthfeel makes this a delightful brew! Pours nearly black w/ a big foamy tan head w/ spotty lacing. Has some nice Christmasy spices in the aroma that draws you in. The taste carries some of these spices but it’s a touch thin which kind of waters down the flavor. The light body is actually quite enjoyable tho! Solid beer!

2014 version. Classy; pretty impressive amount of spices atop a caramel malt nose: allspice, pine, gingerbread, star anise, juniper? Who knows. A “flat coke” signoff. Little thinner than, but reminds me of, Kerkom’s "Winterkoninkske" beer – a good thing. Sweetness is balanced out with a slight bitterness (that sort of light end typical of, say, Porterhouse Brewery). I know this is going to sound very “Waitrose” (up-market UK supermarket), but it does remind of the year Heston Blumenthal did mince pies with pine sugar; maybe it’s the Christmas thing.
Pours deep with medium beige head. Nose is malts and whisky. Aromas are toasted malts, herbal hops, whiskey and woody notes. Low carbonation, medium body. Medium earthy finish.

Bottle at desk in work . From beer hawk. A dark black / caramel brown coloured pour with a lasting light tan head. Aroma is liquorice spiced spruce tips, woody nutmeg, brown sugars, christmas spice. Flavour is composed of bitter black liquorice, chared wood, spruce and pine needles, some jammy fruits, apricot. Palate is medium bodied, medium sweet, powdery highish carbonaton, semi drying. Decent for a SHV.

Dark nutty color with a fine tan head. Looks nice. Ok intensity in the aroma. Medium (+) body and an average carbonation. Tad sweet and a moderate bitterness. Bready, some spices, fruity and toffee.
[Bottle (as Christmas Ale) from Gundersen]

as always wonderful cinnamon nutmeg and gingerbread aroma with a caramel note also..dark brown no light passes thru with tan filmy head and lacing..taste a little more hoppy(pine) than apparent in the nose with the abovementioned cinnamon ginger flavors as well burnt malts and smoke apparent as well surprisingly dry finish..light-medium bodied long dry finish with a coka cola like aftertaste this isn’t my favorite one could use more sweetness and is even slightly harsh,still unusual and tasty though, a hop fan may rate this higher (2015 batch)

Bottle from Cocktails, Littleborough. 2013 Christmas Ale version. Dark reddish-brown with a thick frothy head. Includes plenty of dark malt, which is lightly spiced, with hints of roasted malt, but mainly sweet.

355 mL bottle. Dark brown pour bordering on black. couple fingers of light tan head, large uniform bubbles, reduces to to a thin ring / cap.Interesting aroma, spice, licorice and blueberries. Taste is more caramel and spice with a fairly strong roast bitter finish. Medium to fine carbonation with a thin body. The strong roast finish says sip but palate says gulp, otherwise pretty darn good.

2015 The beer is dark even black when you pour it.
The foam is beige with large bubbles.
Smells against some little, and the taste is less than I expected.
But the malt is there and some brödighet.
The scents here are darker but still a bit tame.
A little dark bread, raisins, dark syrup.
Find some chocolate, vanilla, caramel, nuts and a little Christmas spices.
A little malt and hops dull, maybe some coffee.
At first sip, the whole beer a bit smaller than expected, a little more tasteless and dropped character.
Is a roasted flavor, the bread will find fairly quickly, with hints of raisins.
Are some sweetness by the vanilla, chocolate, caramel, malt.
Are some Christmas spices, cardamom, nuts, slabbe coffee.
A little more carbon dioxide than I thought with it disappears quickly, a little bitter at the end.

2015 Draft @ Concourse, LAX. Slightly sweet aroma. Black color with dark reddish highlights, and tan head with good lacing. Slightly sweet, malty flavor, with slight bitterness. Med bodied. Overall a pretty good holiday beer.
33cl bottle. Dark brown color. Brown medium head. Medium bitterness, low to medium sweetness. Aroma is roasted, herby, woody, leaves, fruits.

Bottle 0.355l from Only Good Beer Budapest Hungary.Taste at home Belgrade Serbia.25.12.2015.Merry Chistmas.Pour it dark color with small dark head.Aroma blueberry.Taste of molasis,dark black fruits,licorice, skunky.Interesting spice finish.
The aroma has both rich caramel malt and piney hops; taste is pleasantly sweet; palate is smooth. Great winter beer!

Bottle 2014 merry Christmas. Reddish brown, minimal head. Liquorice in aroma and taste, herbs, and sweets. Strange brew, it’s like a bit oxidated, some cherry or madera like flavours. not good though.
Poured from bottle 2015 dark brown with a nice cocoa color head. Aromas of licorice dark chocolate and spice. Taste is caramel spice and a slightly thin mouth feel with a nice roasty finish.

Anchor Merry Christmas & Happy New Year 2015 is one great present. Dark pour with a thick off-white head that lasts. Aroma of caramel. Taste is spices and caramel with a smooth finish. Very tasty. Get this gift while it lasts!
Drank 27-1 in Malden with Marieke (working on my new year’s resolutions ;)). Taste is fine, pretty complex. Has a nice finish, winterbeer like. Bit thin though.

Si presenta ambra molto scuro con riflessi rossi. Schiuma beige compatta  molto persistente. Al naso caramello, spezie, dark fruits. Gusto speziato, tostato e ingresso secco. Piuttosto dolce. Corpo medio e carbonazione medio bassa. Interessante natalizia.

12 oz. 2011 bottle tasted on 2016-01-22. Pours a deep ruby red color with a finger thick tan head. Aroma is heavy of spices, wood and a little bit of alcohol. Medium body, taste is interesting. A combination of malt and spice but I can’t put my finger on just one thing. Finish is more of the same. A complex beer.

Bottle shared. Just odd in every way. Some debate as to whether bottle is infected and it’s a drain pour. Spice and fake wood notes dominate. Malt profile is somewhat sweet  but oddly bitter finish.  Did not drink.

Don’t know how to rate this since it changes every year and I know it’s been different in the past (and thought I rated it). This is the 2015 version. Very dark brown with malty, woody aromas and an extremely tenacious foamy tan head. A bit of charred malt and light dark and semi-sweet chocolate in the flavor. Medium bodied and a bit watery. Nice roasty finish. Not the best version, but still a tasty winter brew.

Refrigerated 12 oz. 2015 brown bottle poured into a glass. Opaque dark brown with small beige head. Aroma is nice spice, medium body, low carbonation, and some small-bubble lacing. Taste is caramel malt, spice, some and herbal hops. Classic rich tasting brew.
Dark pour with a thin head. Aroma is light with a little spice and grain. Medium bodied. Taste has some spice to it. Yeasty finish. A little chocolate as well.

Version 2015. Un liquide brune foncée avec une superbe mousse. Un nez et une bouche qui goute et sent le chocolat épicé. C’est très épicé mais fort agréable. Peut faire penser à la Résolution avec plus de corps. Très bonne.

Dark brown color with ruby hints, frothy brown head. Aroma has fermented fruits, dark sugar and molasses. Taste is also fruity but without the fermented part. Really balanced, just the finish is slightly bitter and roasty. Body and carbonation are medium. Overall it’s an easy drinking, tasty winter ale.

Bottle pour into nonic pint glass. Aroma is sweet dark fruits, cherry, brown bread, with some chocolate. Appearance is very dark reddish brown--virtually opaque--with finger-width light brown head that dissipates fairly quickly to ring with fair lacing. Taste is sweet dark fruits and molasses with a bit of roasted bitterness and hint of chocolate at the finish. Palate is light-bodied with thin, somewhat slippery texture, average to lively carbonation and light, dry, bitter finish. Overall, the secretiveness of the ingredients only adds to the allure of figuring out what it tastes like. This is quite good, for any season, but does evoke the holidays well. Get it while the gettin’s good!
Bottle. Pours a dark brownish color. Aroma and taste are spices, fruit, and some honey.

Nez: Malt fumé, chocolat, cannelle
Bouche: Chocolat, fumée, fruits noirs, cannelle, épicée
Rien de transcendant mais elle est vraiment très agréable.

Bottle (2015) @home. Pours dark brown almost black with a good thick and creamy tan head. Spices on the nose cinnamon and slight aniseed, also some chocolate, quite malty, dark roasted fruits. Taste is toasted malts, dark chocolate nice bitter finish with a slight almost not there sweet kick.

Very dry and not at all sweet for such a dark beer. Very rich mouthfeel. Powdery bitter cocoa and cardboard. A slight sourness in the after taste. Not much complexity. I’m really surprised by how bad this one is based on this usually great brewery, the ratebeer ratings, my like of malty dark beers. Could it have been a bad bottle?! Almost worth retrying just to find out.

Bottle thanks to Saeglopur? . Dark brown body with tan head. Aroma is nice caramel malts with some roasted malts. Taste is dried fruits with nuts and malts. Aftertaste is nice balanced between roasted malts bitterness and malty sweetness and hints of spices

Bottle, pours dark brown, near black, with a beige head. Spicy, malty and nutty aroma. Dark bread, nutmeg, chestnut, clove. Taste is sweet with a decent bitterness, with burnt dark bread crusts, fudge, walnut, nutmeg, cinnamon, dry leaves, white pepper with the pepper getting more pronounced in the lingering spicy finish. Oily texture, somewhat light bodied, soft carbonation, dry finish. The overload of spices is distracting.

Brown pour with minimum head. Smell is nutmeg and cinnamon and lots of cloves. Basically a Christmas cookie. But it also smells really sweet malty. And... the flavor is too sweet/malty for me. The spices don’t shine in flavor like they do in aroma. Oh well.

Bottle @ home from 2015 - Saveur-Biere.com - Color: deep dark black beer with no carbonation and medium brown head. Smell: roasted malt and caramel domination. Raisin and plums notes. Wood and barrel finish. Taste: light body soy taste very strange with caramel and licorice notes. Plums finish. Sweet. Aftertaste: licorice and caramel. Soy finish. Not my style.
Good holiday beer. Dark brown color. Medium-sized , beige head . Aroma of caramel, plums , spices . Malt and spices in taste , pleasant hoppy bitterness at the end.

Bottle.

A- Chocolate covered cherries, black licorice, spices, dry cocoa.

A- Dark brown color, dark liquid, light brown head.

T-Light tobacco, black licorice, chocolate, dark cherries, spices.

P- Medium body, average texture, average carbonation, rich dry finish.

O- Not what I wanted it to be but as it changes each year I guess expectations have to change with it. At points, it seemed to lack any aroma or flavor at all and felt dry and musty.

As Anchor Christmas Ale at Spuyt in Amsterdam. Creamy, light beige, dense head over a very dark burgundy coloured beer. Aroma of cocoa powder, coriander seed, nutmeg, dried orange peel, some coffee grounds, hazelnut, rosehip tea, aniseed, cloves. Restrainedly sweetish onset of dried fruits and raisins, dried banana, subtle seaweed-like umami accent, medium carbo, soft caramelly maltiness with toasted and nutty edges, some peppery hops in the finish along with retronasal aromatic spices (aniseed, nutmeg, coriander); toasted malt bittersweetness lingers a bit and mouthfeel remains a bit powdery, like most of Anchor’s dark beers. Not the most remarkable Anchor creation perhaps, but a nice winter warmer in any case.

2014 version: aroma is raisins dipped in toffee sauce with malts and dusty hops. Taste contains figs, raisins and slight nutmeg. It’s really weak in the taste, and disappears really quick in the aftertaste. Dusty hop profile.

Couleur noire, bonne mousse beige. Nez caramel, malt toasté et chocolat avec notes houblon légèrement fruité. Gout malt noir, malt tourbé, caramel cuit, reglisse fraiche, épices avec note grillée et baton de réglisse en fin de bouche. Bon corps. Superbe pour 5.5c°

29-12-2017; bottle; at home (bought at Saveur Bière, as part of their December 2017 discovery box). Rating is from the 2015 edition, updated with the 2017 edition. 2016, 2018, 2019 and 2020 editions are also enjoyed.
This beer is a true christmas and new year special. When I think of a beer for this period, I think of a dark heavy strong beer. This beer definitely has the looks of a dark heavy strong beer. The color of the beer is dark brown, almost black, on first sight. When seen with a light behind it, a beautiful ruby red color is revealed. Lovely. On top of the beer a nice layer of light brown soft foam is formed. Foam retention is quite nice. A nice soft drape stays for quite some time. Not bad.
The beer has a nice smell. The smell is quite strong and very special. At first, I smell a little roasted barley aroma, together with a nice licorice and anise aroma. After a lot of sniffs, the smell started to remind me of HP sauce or brown source. Both the sauce and this beer have a bittersweet smokey aroma, with a little sour touch of vinegar. This little sourness is nice, but i definitely need to get used to it. It is quite special, and I don’t really know if I have ever tried a beer like this. Hops give a nice earthy aroma and I also smell some pine. Maybe pine tops have been added to the beer. I also smell some nice spicy yeast notes. All in all, quite a nice beer. 
The taste is pretty much the same as the taste. I taste the same roasted barley flavor and the licorice/anise flavor. There is also this HP sauce flavor, but not as strong as in the smell. Again, the little sourness is something i need to get used to, but it is quite nice. Hoppy pine and earth notes and spicy yeasts finish the beer. It is nicely balanced. It is something different than usual. I like it. The spices give the beer just that interesting touch it needs. They don't overwhelm the natural yeast beer flavors or aromas. 
The palate of the beer is nice. The beer has a nice amount of gas in it. Body is surprisingly light and the texture a bit thin, but not to thin. For a beer this dark, it is smooth and light. Carbonation is medium. The finish of the beer is nice. It has some nice bittersweet spices, liquorice and pine. A very nice beer, just like I expected and hoped it would be. A nice christmas beer indeed.

Bottle of 2015 - dark brown pour with a decent head and faint aromas of sweet tobacco and sherry.
It is quite thin and carbonated in the mouth like a dark lager, with some dark sugar notes, but doesn't really pack enough punch to deliver the festive flavours it promises... There is also a metallic aftertaste that detracts a bit - I have had this in previous years and enjoyed it much more, so maybe this was just a weaker batch. Not bad, but not great; will look forward to a return to form in 2016.

Interesting beer. Lots of fig, plums, and molasses in the aroma. Very chewy and sweet. It tastes like a big oatmeal raisin cookie. Lots of sweetness, with bit hints of molasses, chocolate, nutmeg and spice. Not quite a stout but totally full of complexity and flavor. Definitely a great holiday beer.

Dark pour, two fingers of nice tan head. Nose is dark fruit and spice. Bittersweet. Middle is woody, spice, and dark malt with a medium mouth feel. Finish is unsweetened coco. Not flashy, but delicious.
Pours a dark brown color with excellent lacing. Has very nice head retention as well. Tastes malty and of the usual winter spices. A nice Xmas beer!

Pours dark brown with a medium frothy tan head. Aromas of chocolate, spiced bread, molasses, fudge, cardamom, cloves, burnt chestnuts. Taste is quite roasted, spicy and aromatic. Mouthfeel is medium bodied with medium carbonation.

355ml bottle, 2015 version. Almost black with tan head. Aroma of sweet dark malts, cardamon, christmas spices, sweet black bread and cocoa. Taste is slightly medicinal herbal, black bread, classical Christmas spices, coffe and slightly burnt roasted malts. Medium mouthfeel, medium carbonation and roasted herbal aftertaste.

Dark brown, dissipating head. 
Medium body, moderate flavor, flat mouthfeel eith low heat, carbonation and acidity, avg length but unappealing finish. 
Bitter, dry, low acidity. 
Smoky. 
Nothing I like.

From Tercertiempocervezas. In Teku glass. With Marcos Conde cheese. Playing Duke Grabowski. Peculiar and pleasant spicy/herbal profile that fits well in its chistmas and tree themes, feeling smooth, soft and delicate. Avg 4
